short_summary: Eliminate the threat of pollution and permanently dispose of the Tug Craig Trans, currently located in Marie-Joseph, NS
description: Marine Environmental and Hazards Response (MEHR) requires the services of a Contractor to eliminate the threat of pollution and permanently dispose of the Tug Craig Trans, currently located in Marie-Joseph, NS. In order to permanently eliminate the threat of pollution by the vessel, CCG MEHR requires the following: * All recoverable pollutants be removed from the vessel, * Site and vessel preparation completed for vessel dismantling or towing, * Final disposal of the vessel and its contents at recognized recycling facilities, * Remediation of the worksite

full_summary:
### Permanent Elimination of Pollution Threat Posed by Tug Craig Trans

#### Solicitation: 30004869A
*Reference Number: cb-303-3613469*
*Amendment Number: 5*
*Publication Date: 2023-10-17*
*Closing Date: 2023-10-30T13:00:00*
*Amendment Date: 2023-10-30*

#### Service Description
Marine Environmental and Hazards Response, Canadian Coast Guard (CCG MEHR) Atlantic Region invites bidders to submit a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the permanent elimination of the pollution threat posed by the Tug Craig Trans, located at Marie-Joseph, New Brunswick.

#### Scope of Work
The successful bidder will be responsible for:
* Developing a safety plan and timeline for pollutant removal and site preparation
* Removing recoverable pollutants from the vessel
* Preparing the site and vessel for dismantling or towing
* Disposing of vessel and its contents at recognized recycling facilities
* Remediation of the worksite

#### Mandatory Requirements
To be eligible for consideration, bidders must demonstrate:
* 5 years of experience in marine salvage or maritime industry within the last 15 years
* Experience in pollutant removal and dismantling operations of steel-hulled vessels on at least two separate occasions within the last 10 years
* Key personnel with a minimum of 2 years' experience in pollutant removal, marine survey, and stability assessments, and experience in steel hull vessel deconstruction and recycling operations

#### Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated on the basis of the mandatory criteria, as well as the following:
* The bidder's operations plan, which details how they will perform the removal of the Tug Craig Trans
* The bidder's site and vessel preparation and remediation plans

#### Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to various trade agreements, including WTO-GPA and CFTA.

#### Security Clearance
This procurement requires a security clearance; however, an escort will be provided at DFO sites.

#### Additional Information
The contract will be for a period of approximately 5 months, from contract award to 28 February 2024. Bidders are required to provide a detailed operations plan, as specified in the Evaluation Criteria.

Contact:
Mazen Obeid, Mazen.Obeid@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, (613) 299-2564.
Links to Tender Documents: [PDF Link], [Word Link
